remarks.format: ## Remarks 當處理程序啟動時，common language runtime 會自動建立單一的前景執行緒來執行應用程式程式碼。When a process starts, the common language runtime automatically creates a single foreground thread to execute application code. 這個主要的前景執行緒，以及處理程序可以建立一或多個執行緒來執行此程序相關聯的程式碼的一部分。Along with this main foreground thread, a process can create one or more threads to execute a portion of the program code associated with the process. 這些執行緒可以執行在前景或背景。These threads can execute either in the foreground or in the background. 此外，您可以使用common language runtime 所管理的背景工作執行緒上執行程式碼的類別。In addition, you can use the class to execute code on worker threads that are managed by the common language runtime. 本節內容In this section [正在啟動的執行緒](#Starting) [Starting a thread](#Starting) [擷取執行緒物件](#Retrieving) [Retrieving Thread objects](#Retrieving) [前景和背景執行緒](#Foreground) [Foreground and background threads](#Foreground) [文化特性和執行緒](#Culture) [Culture and threads](#Culture) [取得相關資訊和控制執行緒Getting information about and controlling threads](#Properties) ## 正在啟動的執行緒Starting a thread 您可以啟動執行緒藉由提供委派，表示執行緒會在其類別建構函式中執行的方法。You start a thread by supplying a delegate that represents the method the thread is to execute in its class constructor. 然後呼叫方法，開始執行。You then call the method to begin execution. 建構函式可以採用兩個委派類型，取決於是否將引數傳遞至方法，以執行：The constructors can take either of two delegate types, depending on whether you can pass an argument to the method to be executed: - 如果方法沒有引數，傳遞委派建構函式。If the method has no arguments, you pass a delegate to the constructor. 其簽章：It has the signature: ```csharp public delegate void ThreadStart() ``` ```vb Public Delegate Sub ThreadStart() ``` 下列範例會建立並啟動執行的執行緒`ExecuteInForeground`方法。The following example creates and starts a thread that executes the `ExecuteInForeground` method. 方法會顯示某些執行緒屬性的相關資訊，然後執行的迴圈，在其中方法，它可以半秒就會暫停，並顯示經過的秒數。The method displays information about some thread properties, then executes a loop in which it pauses for half a second and displays the elapsed number of seconds. 當執行緒已執行至少 5 秒時，迴圈結束，執行緒會結束執行。When the thread has executed for at least five seconds, the loop ends and the thread terminates execution. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread/cs/ThreadStart1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread/vb/ThreadStart1.vb#1)] - 如果方法沒有引數，傳遞委派建構函式。If the method has an argument, you pass a delegate to the constructor. 其簽章：It has the signature: ```csharp public delegate void ParameterizedThreadStart(object obj) ``` ```vb Public Delegate Sub ParameterizedThreadStart(obj As Object) ``` 然後委派所執行的方法可以轉型 （在 C# 中)，或者 （在 Visual Basic) 將參數轉換成適當的類型。The method executed by the delegate can then cast (in C#) or convert (in Visual Basic) the parameter to the appropriate type. 下列範例等同於前一個位置，不同之處在於它會呼叫建構函式。The following example is identical to the previous one, except that it calls the constructor. 這個版本的`ExecuteInForeground`方法具有單一參數，表示迴圈是要執行的毫秒數的近似數目。This version of the `ExecuteInForeground` method has a single parameter that represents the approximate number of milliseconds the loop is to execute. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread/cs/ThreadStart2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread/vb/ThreadStart2.vb#2)] 您不需要保留的參考物件啟動執行緒之後。It is not necessary to retain a reference to a object once you have started the thread. 執行緒會繼續執行直到執行緒程序完成。The thread continues to execute until the thread procedure is complete. ## 擷取執行緒物件Retrieving Thread objects 您可以使用靜態 (`Shared`在 Visual Basic 中)屬性來擷取目前執行中執行緒的執行緒正在執行的程式碼的參考。You can use the static (`Shared` in Visual Basic) property to retrieve a reference to the currently executing thread from the code that the thread is executing. 下列範例會使用屬性來顯示主應用程式執行緒、 另一個前景執行緒，背景執行緒，以及執行緒集區執行緒相關資訊。The following example uses the property to display information about the main application thread, another foreground thread, a background thread, and a thread pool thread. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread/cs/Instance1.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread/vb/Instance1.vb#4)] ## 前景和背景執行緒Foreground and background threads 執行個體類別代表前景執行緒或背景執行緒。Instances of the class represent either foreground threads or background threads. 背景執行緒會與相同前景執行緒有一個例外狀況： 在背景執行緒不會保存執行的處理序，如果所有前景執行緒已經都終止。Background threads are identical to foreground threads with one exception: a background thread does not keep a process running if all foreground threads have terminated. 一旦所有前景執行緒已都停止，則執行階段會停止所有背景執行緒，並關閉。Once all foreground threads have been stopped, the runtime stops all background threads and shuts down. 根據預設，下列執行緒會在前景中執行：By default, the following threads execute in the foreground: - 主要的應用程式執行緒。The main application thread. - 藉由呼叫所建立的所有執行緒類別建構函式。All threads created by calling a class constructor. 根據預設，在背景中執行下列的執行緒：The following threads execute in the background by default: - 執行緒集區執行緒，也就是由執行階段所維護的背景工作執行緒集區。Thread pool threads, which are a pool of worker threads maintained by the runtime. 您也可以使用執行緒集區執行緒上設定執行緒集區和排程工作類別。You can configure the thread pool and schedule work on thread pool threads by using the class. > [!NOTE] > 在執行緒集區執行緒上自動執行工作為基礎的非同步作業。Task-based asynchronous operations automatically execute on thread pool threads. 使用以工作為基礎的非同步作業並類別來實作[工作架構非同步模式](~/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/task-based-asynchronous-pattern-tap.md)。Task-based asynchronous operations use the and classes to implement the [task-based asynchronous pattern](~/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/task-based-asynchronous-pattern-tap.md). - 從 unmanaged 程式碼來進入 managed 的執行環境的所有執行緒。All threads that enter the managed execution environment from unmanaged code. 您可以變更執行緒在背景中執行，藉由設定在任何時間的屬性。You can change a thread to execute in the background by setting the property at any time. 背景執行緒可用於任何作業，只要應用程式正在執行，但應該不會防止終止，例如監視檔案系統變更或傳入的通訊端連線應用程式應該繼續。Background threads are useful for any operation that should continue as long as an application is running but should not prevent the application from terminating, such as monitoring file system changes or incoming socket connections. 下列範例說明前景和背景執行緒之間的差異。The following example illustrates the difference between foreground and background threads. 就像中的第一個範例一樣[正在啟動的執行緒](#Starting)區段中，不同之處在於它會設定要在背景啟動前先執行的執行緒。It is like the first example in the [Starting a thread](#Starting) section, except that it sets the thread to execute in the background before starting it. 如輸出所示，然後才執行五秒將會中斷迴圈。As the output shows, the loop is interrupted before it executes for five seconds. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Thread#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread/cs/BackgroundEx1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Thread#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Threading.Thread/vb/BackgroundEx1.vb#3)] ## 文化特性和執行緒Culture and threads 每個執行緒都所代表文化特性屬性和 UI 文化特性，以表示屬性。Each thread has a culture, represented by the property, and a UI culture, represented by the property. 目前的文化特性支援剖析和格式化、 字串比較和排序，這種區分文化特性的作業，而且也會控制執行緒所使用的行事曆與書寫系統。The current culture supports such culture-sensitive operations as parsing and formatting, string comparison and sorting, and also controls the writing system and calendar used by a thread. 目前的 UI 文化特性提供區分文化特性擷取資源檔中的資源。The current UI culture provides for culture-sensitive retrieval of resources in resource files. > [!IMPORTANT] > 和屬性無法可靠地運作，搭配目前的執行緒以外的任何執行緒時。The and properties don't work reliably when used with any thread other than the current thread. 在.NET Framework 中，讀取這些屬性是可靠的但不設定這些屬性目前的執行緒以外的執行緒。In .NET Framework, reading these properties is reliable, although setting these properties for a thread other than the current thread is not. 在.NET Core 上如果執行緒嘗試讀取或寫入這些屬性在不同的執行緒上擲回。On .NET Core, an is thrown if a thread attempts to read or write these properties on a different thread. > 我們建議您改用和屬性，以擷取和設定目前的文化特性。We recommend that you use the and properties to retrieve and set the current culture. 具現化新的執行緒時，其文化特性和 UI 文化特性定義的目前系統文化特性和 UI 文化特性，而不是文化特性和 UI 文化特性，從中建立新的執行緒的執行緒。When a new thread is instantiated, its culture and UI culture are defined by the current system culture and UI culture, and not by the culture and UI culture of the thread from which the new thread is created. 這表示，例如，如果目前的系統文化特性是英文 （美國） 和主要應用程式執行緒的目前文化特性是法文 （法國），藉由呼叫所建立的新執行緒的文化特性從主執行緒的建構函式英文 （美國） 和法文 （法國）。This means, for example, that if the current system culture is English (United States) and the current culture of the primary application thread is French (France), the culture of a new thread created by calling the constructor from the primary thread is English (United States), and not French (France). 如需詳細資訊，請參閱的 < 文化特性和執行緒 」 區段類別主題。For more information, see the "Culture and threads" section of the class topic. > [!IMPORTANT] > 這不是執行非同步作業的應用程式為目標的執行緒，則為 true[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]和更新版本中的，在此情況下，文化特性和 UI 文化特性是一部分的非同步作業的內容; 的執行緒上非同步作業執行預設繼承的文化特性和 UI 文化特性，從中啟動非同步作業的執行緒。This is not true of threads that execute asynchronous operations for apps that target the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)] and later versions, In this case, the culture and UI culture is part of an asynchronous operations' context; the thread on which an asynchronous operation executes by default inherits the culture and UI culture of the thread from which the asynchronous operation was launched. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 類別主題的＜文化特性和以工作為基礎的非同步作業＞一節。For more information, see the "Culture and task-based asynchronous operations" section of the class topic. 您可以執行下列動作，以確保所有的執行緒執行的應用程式中共用相同的文化特性和 UI 文化特性：You can do either of the following to ensure that all of the threads executing in an application share the same culture and UI culture: - 您可以傳遞物件，表示該文化特性委派或方法。You can pass a object that represents that culture to the delegate or the method. - 在上執行的應用程式[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]和更新版本中，您可以定義要指派給所設定的值建立應用程式定義域中的所有執行緒 UI 文化特性與文化特性和屬性。For apps running on the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] and later versions, you can define the culture and UI culture that is to be assigned to all threads created in an application domain by setting the value of the and properties. 請注意，這是每個應用程式定義域的設定。Note that this is a per-application domain setting. 如需詳細資訊和範例，請參閱 「 文化特性和執行緒 > 一節類別主題。For more information and examples, see the "Culture and threads" section of the class topic. ## 取得相關資訊和控制執行緒Getting information about and controlling threads 您可以擷取提供執行緒的相關資訊的屬性值的數目。You can retrieve a number of property values that provide information about a thread. 在某些情況下，您也可以設定這些屬性值，來控制執行緒的作業。In some cases, you can also set these property values to control the operation of the thread. 這些執行緒屬性包括：These thread properties include: - 名稱。A name. 已寫入-一次您可用來識別在執行緒中的屬性。 is a write-once property that you can use to identify a thread. 其預設值是`null`。Its default value is `null`. - 雜湊程式碼，您可以藉由呼叫擷取方法。A hash code, which you can retrieve by calling the method. 雜湊程式碼可以用來唯一識別執行緒;您的執行緒的存留期內，其雜湊程式碼不將與來自其他執行緒，不論您要從中取得值的應用程式定義域的值相衝突。The hash code can be used to uniquely identify a thread; for the lifetime of your thread, its hash code will not collide with the value from any other thread, regardless of the application domain from which you obtain the value. - 執行緒 id。A thread ID. 唯讀值屬性由執行階段所指派，以及可唯一識別其處理序內的執行緒。The value of the read-only property is assigned by the runtime and uniquely identifies a thread within its process. > [!NOTE] > 作業系統的 [ThreadId](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms683233.aspx) 與 Managed 執行緒之間沒有固定的關係，因為未受管理的主機可控制 Managed 執行緒與 Unmanaged 執行緒之間的關係。An operating-system [ThreadId](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms683233.aspx) has no fixed relationship to a managed thread, because an unmanaged host can control the relationship between managed and unmanaged threads. 具體來說，精密的主機可以使用[CLR 裝載 API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms404385.aspx)排程許多 managed 的執行緒，對相同的作業系統執行緒，或不同的作業系統執行緒之間移動 managed 的執行緒。Specifically, a sophisticated host can use the [CLR Hosting API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms404385.aspx) to schedule many managed threads against the same operating system thread, or to move a managed thread between different operating system threads. - 執行緒的目前狀態。The thread's current state. 其存在期間，執行緒一律是在一或多個定義的狀態屬性。For the duration of its existence, a thread is always in one or more of the states defined by the property. - 排程的優先權層級，可定義屬性。A scheduling priority level, which is defined by the property. 雖然您可以設定此值，以要求執行緒的優先權，它不保證適用於作業系統。Although you can set this value to request a thread's priority, it is not guaranteed to be honored by the operating system. - 唯讀屬性，指出執行緒是否在執行緒集區執行緒。The read-only property, which indicates whether a thread is a thread pool thread. - 屬性。The property. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 < [ CLR 幫浦內訊息的清除，這可能會造成一些符合下列準則不尋常的應用程式的重新進入問題：The CLR pumps messages during the cleanup, which might cause reentrancy problems for a few applications that meet the following unusual criteria: - 應用程式會自己訊息幫浦作業。The application does its own message pumping. - 應用程式需要訊息幫浦，就會發生時，精確地控制。The application needs to control precisely when message pumping occurs. 這類應用程式可以使用會造成 CLR 無法進行自動回收的執行階段可呼叫包裝函式的方法。Such applications can use the method to prevent the CLR from doing automatic reclamation of runtime callable wrappers. 已呼叫這個方法在執行緒上時自動清除無法重新啟用該執行緒。When this method has been called on a thread, automatic cleanup cannot be re-enabled for that thread. 您的應用程式準備好要清除執行階段可呼叫包裝函式時，請使用方法來指示要清除所有執行階段可呼叫包裝函式在目前內容中的執行階段。When your application is ready to clean up runtime callable wrappers, use the method to instruct the runtime to clean up all runtime callable wrappers in the current context. 此方法執行時，就會發生訊息幫浦作業。Message pumping occurs while the method executes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 主控件，例如 Microsoft SQL Server 2005，common language runtime (CLR)，可以建立不同的原則中的程式碼的重大和非關鍵區域的失敗。Hosts of the common language runtime (CLR), such as Microsoft SQL Server 2005, can establish different policies for failures in critical and non-critical regions of code. 關鍵區域是在其執行緒中止或未處理的例外狀況的影響可能不會限制為目前的工作。A critical region is one in which the effects of a thread abort or an unhandled exception might not be limited to the current task. 相較之下，中止或非關鍵的程式碼區域中的失敗會影響只有工作發生錯誤。By contrast, an abort or failure in a non-critical region of code affects only the task in which the error occurs. 例如，請考慮嘗試配置記憶體的鎖定時的工作。For example, consider a task that attempts to allocate memory while holding a lock. 如果記憶體配置失敗，正在中止目前的工作並不足以確保穩定性，因為在等候相同鎖定的網域中可以有其他工作。If the memory allocation fails, aborting the current task is not sufficient to ensure stability of the , because there can be other tasks in the domain waiting for the same lock. 如果終止目前的工作，就可能發生死結其他工作。If the current task is terminated, other tasks could be deadlocked. 發生失敗時的關鍵區域中，主應用程式可能會決定要卸載整個而不是花在可能不穩定的狀態繼續執行的風險。When a failure occurs in a critical region, the host might decide to unload the entire rather than take the risk of continuing execution in a potentially unstable state. 若要向主應用程式通知，您的程式碼正在進入關鍵區域，呼叫。To inform the host that your code is entering a critical region, call . 呼叫當執行會返回到非關鍵的程式碼區域。Call when execution returns to a non-critical region of code. 在 SQL Server 2005 中執行的程式碼中使用這個方法需要最高的主機保護層級執行的程式碼。Using this method in code that runs under SQL Server 2005 requires the code to be run at the highest host protection level. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用和分成重大和非重大的區域中的程式碼區塊的方法。The following example demonstrates the use of the and methods to divide a block of code into critical and non-critical regions. remarks.format: ## Remarks 某些主機的 common language runtime，例如 Microsoft SQL Server 2005，提供自己的執行緒管理。Some hosts of the common language runtime, such as Microsoft SQL Server 2005, provide their own thread management. 提供它自己的執行緒管理的主機正在執行的工作從一個實體作業系統執行緒之間移動在任何時間。A host that provides its own thread management can move an executing task from one physical operating system thread to another at any time. 大部分的工作不會影響此切換。Most tasks are not affected by this switching. 不過，某些工作具有執行緒相似性-也就是相依實體作業系統執行緒的身分識別。However, some tasks have thread affinity - that is, they depend on the identity of a physical operating system thread. 這些工作必須通知主應用程式，當他們執行應該沒問題的程式碼。These tasks must inform the host when they execute code that should not be switched. 例如，如果應用程式會呼叫系統 API 取得作業系統鎖定具有執行緒親和性，例如 Win32 critical_section 做，您必須呼叫之前取得鎖定，以及之後釋放鎖定。For example, if your application calls a system API to acquire an operating system lock that has thread affinity, such as a Win32 CRITICAL_SECTION, you must call before acquiring the lock, and after releasing the lock. 在 SQL Server 2005 中執行的程式碼中使用這個方法需要最高的主機保護層級執行的程式碼。Using this method in code that runs under SQL Server 2005 requires the code to be run at the highest host protection level. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用和方法，以通知程式碼區塊，取決於實體作業系統執行緒的身分識別的主機。The following example demonstrates the use of the and methods to notify a host that a block of code depends on the identity of a physical operating system thread. remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > .NET Framework 會提供兩種機制來使用執行緒區域儲存區 (TLS): 執行緒相關靜態欄位 (也就是標示的欄位屬性) 和資料位置。The .NET Framework provides two mechanisms for using thread local storage (TLS): thread-relative static fields (that is, fields that are marked with the attribute) and data slots. 執行緒相關靜態欄位提供比資料插槽更好的效能，並可編譯時期類型檢查。Thread-relative static fields provide much better performance than data slots, and enable compile-time type checking. 如需使用 TLS 的詳細資訊，請參閱[執行緒區域儲存區：執行緒相關靜態欄位和資料位置](~/docs/standard/threading/thread-local-storage-thread-relative-static-fields-and-data-slots.md)。For more information about using TLS, see [Thread Local Storage: Thread-Relative Static Fields and Data Slots](~/docs/standard/threading/thread-local-storage-thread-relative-static-fields-and-data-slots.md). 執行緒會使用本機存放區記憶體機制來儲存執行緒特定資料。Threads use a local store memory mechanism to store thread-specific data. 建立時，common language runtime 會配置到每個處理序的多位置資料存放區陣列。The common language runtime allocates a multi-slot data store array to each process when it is created. 執行緒可以配置的資料存放區中的資料位置、 儲存及擷取資料中的位置、 值和釋放執行緒程序結束後的重複使用的位置和已經由記憶體回收回收物件。The thread can allocate a data slot in the data store, store and retrieve a data value in the slot, and free the slot for reuse after the thread procedure ends and the object has been reclaimed by garbage collection. 資料位置是每個執行緒的唯一的。Data slots are unique per thread. 沒有任何其他執行緒 （甚至子執行緒） 可以取得該資料。No other thread (not even a child thread) can get that data. > [!NOTE] > 是`Shared`一律會套用到目前正在執行的執行緒，即使您使用的變數，指的是另一個執行緒呼叫的方法。 is a `Shared` method that always applies to the currently executing thread, even if you call it using a variable that refers to another thread. 若要避免混淆，請使用類別名稱呼叫時`Shared`方法： `Thread.SetData(testSlot, "test data")`。To avoid confusion, use the class name when calling `Shared` methods: `Thread.SetData(testSlot, "test data")`. ## remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果這個方法成功，會產生執行緒的目前時間配量的其餘部分。If this method succeeds, the rest of the thread's current time slice is yielded. 作業系統排程另一個時間配量，根據其優先順序和可執行其他執行緒的狀態呼叫的執行緒。The operating system schedules the calling thread for another time slice, according to its priority and the status of other threads that are available to run. 產生僅限於用來執行呼叫的執行緒的處理器。Yielding is limited to the processor that is executing the calling thread. 作業系統不會切換執行為另一個處理器，即使該處理器處於閒置狀態，或正在執行較低優先權的執行緒。The operating system will not switch execution to another processor, even if that processor is idle or is running a thread of lower priority. 如果有沒有其他準備好在目前的處理器上執行的執行緒、 作業系統不會產生執行，且這個方法會傳回`false`。If there are no other threads that are ready to execute on the current processor, the operating system does not yield execution, and this method returns `false`. 這個方法相當於使用平台叫用呼叫原生 Win32`SwitchToThread`函式。This method is equivalent to using platform invoke to call the native Win32 `SwitchToThread` function. 您應該呼叫方法，而不是使用平台叫用，因為平台叫用任何自訂的執行緒行為主應用程式已要求的許可。You should call the method instead of using platform invoke, because platform invoke bypasses any custom threading behavior the host has requested.
